description.en:
The Baltic Sea region or Northern Europe is not very tightly populated area but there are ten different countries. Each of them has unique political system. There are many similarities between the countries but also several important differences. All except one are liberal democracies. Russian political elite has tried to define their political system as sovereign democracy but in reality it functions as an authoritarian regime where democracy is used only as window dressing. Poland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania have made through a complex transition process during last 30 years and their systems belong to the same group with old democracies in the Nordic countries as well as in Germany. However, during the last years the Polish government has implemented several reforms that have caused hesitation to define Poland as a liberal democracy. Although Germany and Russia are both federal countries then they follow completely different principles. This course focuses on similarities and differences in the Baltic Sea countries, in order to understand how political systems function in these countries. 
The following topics will be addressed: the political systems of the BSR; the defining political system in each particular state; political institutions; constitutions; legislatures; relations between the legislative and executive branch; major political actors behind parties and interest groups in each state and their influence on policy-making, civil and political rights; social trust and tolerance towards minorities, gender equality and social integration.
description.et:
Läänemere regioon elik Põhja-Euroopa ei ole väga tihedalt asustatud piirkond, kuid siia kuulub kümme erinevat riiki, millel on oma unikaalne poliitiline süsteem. Nendes süsteemides on küll palju sarnaseid elemente, kuid ka mitmed olulised erinevused. Kõik peale ühe on liberaalsed demokraatiad. Venemaa poliitiline eliit on proovinud oma riigis valitsevat režiimi nimetada küll suveräänseks demokraatiaks, mis sisuliselt toimib autoritaarse režiimina, mida kaunistab demokraatia üksnes sildina. Poola, Eesti, Läti ja Leedu on teinud läbi keeruka siirdeprotsessi viimase ligemale 30 aasta jooksul ning nende poliitilised süsteemid kuuluvad samasse gruppi pikaajaliste demokraatiatega Põhjamaades ning ka Saksamaal. Viimastel aastatel on Poolas võimule tulnud valitsus viinud ellu rida reforme, mis on tõstatanud küsimus, kas Poola siiski kuulub liberaalsete demokraatiate hulka. Kuigi Saksamaa ja Venemaa on mõlemad föderaalriigid, siis föderatsioon toimib kardinaalselt erinevatel põhimõtetel. See kursus keskendubki nendele sarnasustele ja erinevustele Läänemeremaades, mõistmaks kuidas poliitilised süsteemid nendes riikides toimivad. 
Kursuse käigus analüüsitakse järgmiseid teemasid ja küsimusi: Läänemere riikide poliitilised süsteemid: poliitilise süsteemi definitsioonid, poliitilised institutsioonid ja nende suhted, konstitutsioonid, seadusandja ja selle roll, seadusandva ja täidesaatva võimu suhted, peamised poliitilised tegijad nagu parteid ja huvigrupid, nende mõju poliitilisele süsteemile, kodanikuõigused ja -vabadused, sotsiaalne usaldus ja tolerants vähemuste suhtes, sooline võrdõiguslikkus, sotsiaalne lõimumine.

objectives.en: The objective of this course is to compare and contrast different political systems in the Baltic Sea Region. It reviews party systems and electoral politics, the current state of civil liberties and political rights as well as explores the level of social integration in the countries of the BSR. It asks how democratic are these political systems and what conditions democratization in the whole region.
objectives.et:
Kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada Läänemere regiooni poliitiliste süsteemide eripärasid ning sarnasusi. Kursus annab ülevaate Läänemeremaade nii poliitilistest institutsioonidest, erakondade dünaamikast ja valimistulemustest kui ka nende ühiskondade sotsiaalsest integreeritusest ja kodanikeõigustest.
Kursus tervikuna proovib vastata peamistele küsimustele, mis on olulised käsitlemaks kõiki regiooni riike: kui demokraatlikud on süsteemid ning millised on võtmetähendusega näitajad, mis aitavad mõista Läänemere regiooni poliitiliste süsteemide demokraatlikku iseloomu.

learning_outcomes.en: - compares different political systems in the Baltic Sea region and their developments from the historical as well as theoretical perspective;
learning_outcomes.et: - võrdleb erinevaid poliitilisi süsteeme Läänemere regioonis ning nende kujunemist nii ajaloolisest kui ka teoreetilisest perspektiivist;

learning_outcomes.en: - compares and assesses different institutional set-ups of the Baltic Sea region countries;
learning_outcomes.et: - võrdleb ning hindab erinevaid poliitiste institutsioonide kooslusi Läänemeremaades;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows main political parties in the Baltic Sea region and their historical developments;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb peamisi erakondi Läänemere regioonis ja nende ajaloolist kujunemist;

learning_outcomes.en: - compares main electoral trends in the Baltic Sea region (since the 1990s);
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb ja võrdleb peamisi valimistrende (alates 1990-ndatest) Läänemere regiooni riikides;

learning_outcomes.en: - assesses societal integrity (incl. ethnic minorities, gender rights) in the Baltic Sea countries and defines factors that influence it;
learning_outcomes.et: - hindab ühiskondlikku terviklikkust (sh etnilised vähemused, sooline tasakaal) erinevates Läänemeremaades ning nende kujunemist mõjutavaid faktoreid;

learning_outcomes.en: - sets a socio-political research puzzle and analyses it in a comparative perspective (at least two cases from the Baltic Sea region) based on academic literature.
learning_outcomes.et: - määratleb selge sotsio-poliitilise uurimisküsimuse ning uurib seda võrdlevas perspektiivis (vähemalt kaks Läänemere regiooni riiki), tuginedes akadeemilistele allikatele.

independent_work.et: Independent study reflection papers, final research paper. Detailed guidelines are provided in Moodle.

description.et:
See the detailed assessment matrix in Moodle. 

NB! Papers where has been found plagiarism will fail automatically and student would fail the entire course without right to have resit during ongoing semester.

The reflection paper will be assessed based on the scale:
10 - (very good and thorough reflection, the reflection connects very well earlier knowledge and new information, it provides interesting and relevant analysis, it includes independent thought)
6 - (good summary, it provides a good summary what was discussed in the classroom, it does not elaborate topics for further analysis than only in the classroom stated positions, it does also not demonstrate an independent analytical engagement with the topic)
2 - (poor summary, it mentions superficially topics discussed in the class, it does not demonstrate proper working through the given materials, neither not very good understanding of discussed topics, it also fails to provide any independent analysis, it mainly describes the study objects)
0 - (no submission).

grade_preconditions.et: At least 11 attendances of the weekly classroom meetings.

grade_evaluation.et:
Independent study reflection papers (3, a 10 points) - 30% of the final grade
Final research paper - 40% of the final grade
Final exam - 30% of the final grade (exam June 5 or June 17)

NB! In order to pass the course student should obtain at least 18 points for the reflection papers, 25 points for the research paper and 16 points for the exam.

debt_elimination.et: By individual agreement with the course instructor
